set.question: A school that provides the first part of a child's education, usually for children between five and eleven years old.
To not do something that you were going to do, or to stop doing something before you have completely finished.
A person whose work is teaching others, or one who is an authority on methods or theories of teaching.
Someone who has agreed to work for a skilled person for a particular period of time and often for low payment, in order to learn that person's skills.
A person's way of thinking and their opinions.
An effect, a reaction, a connection, a response and/or an experience of customers with each other, with a company or with a brand.
An occasion or situation that makes it possible to do something that you want to do or have to do, or the possibility of doing something.
Not taking help or money from other people.
A method of learning where students are given freedom in how, what, when and where they learn.
A young person between 13 and 19 years old.
A piece of planned work or activity that is finished over a period of time and intended to achieve a particular purpose.
All the courses given in a school, college,.. or a particular course of study in one subject.
